title: Software Developer
description:
Why Join Us?
   

  

 At Check Point, we’re not just redefining network security — we’re rewriting the
   

  

 rulebook
   

  

 Our SASE R\\&D team is where creativity meets AI\\-driven cybersecurity.
   

  

 We build scalable, cloud\\-native systems that protect millions every single day
   

  

 If you want to shape the future of secure connectivity — faster, smarter, and bolder
   

  

 — this is the place.
   

  

 We’re on the lookout for a code wizard (1–3 yrs exp) fluent in Go, C, and C\\+\\+
   

  

 If data structures are your playground, debugging your sport, and network puzzles
   

  

 your daily brain gym — then you’ve just found your tribe.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

* Build sleek, high\\-performance Go/C/C\\+\\+ code powering core network and microservice magic
* Design and scale cloud\\-native distributed systems that never blink under pressure
* Bring AI\\-driven intelligence into network and security workflows (because “automation” is too last decade )
* Jump into code reviews, CI/CD pipelines, and agile sprints like a pro
* Collaborate with global brains to push SASE and secure connectivity forward
* Help shape a curious, inclusive, and high\\-energy engineering culture


**Qualifications**
* 1–3 years of hands\\-on coding experience (Go, C, or C\\+\\+)
* Killer problem\\-solving \\+ debugging chops
* Love for Linux, networks, and cloud systems (bonus points!)
* Curiosity for AI \\+ cybersecurity and how they can change the game
* A CS degree or equivalent hustle — top\\-tier institutes.

title: Software Developer
description:
Why Join Us?
   

  

 We are looking for a seasoned Software Developer to be a key player in our fast\\-growing Core Network Group R\\&D department. You will be building and developing a next\\-generation SASE solution. Dive into the world of microservices, distributed systems, networking, and scalable software design, and leave your mark on cutting\\-edge developments impacting millions of users and organizations.
   

  

 We are looking for a proactive, fast learner, innovative engineer who is ready to revolutionize the industry.
   

  

**About Us**
 Check Point is a key player the network security field, striving to provide the leading SASE platform in the market. Our innovative approach, merging cloud and on\\-device protection, redefines how businesses connect in the era of cloud and remote work.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

* Writing scalable, robust, testable, efficient, and easily maintainable code and services that are part of our Core Network as a Service components
* Develop advanced services of cloud network solutions
* Maintain high\\-performing, scalable, and testable code
* Practice peer review and collaborative programming
* Work with a diverse multicultural team in an agile environment


**Qualifications**
* BE / B.Tech in CS/CE or similar field, with a minimum of 10\\+years of software development experience
* Proficient in C\\+\\+, C, GO programming and debugging
* Experienced in Unix/Linux systems with proficiency in user\\-space processes, kernel, socket programming, inter\\-process communication
* Experience with networking protocols, routing, tunnelling, etc. is a must
* Strong verbal and written communication skills. Able to communicate in an open, transparent and consistent manner with team and co\\-workers.
* Innovative and out\\-of\\-the box thinking to foster original ideas.
* Experience with architecture and design of distributed services/microservices / scalable solutions is a big advantage
* Experience in a cloud environment is an advantage
* Experience with NoSQL databases is an advantage
* DevOps mentality is a big plus

title: Software Developer
description:
**About The Company**
 Linfox Asia is a prominent third\\-party logistics provider operating across the Asia Pacific region. Renowned for our commitment to excellence and innovation, we deliver comprehensive supply chain solutions tailored to meet the diverse needs of our clients. Our extensive network, advanced technology integration, and dedicated team enable us to optimize logistics operations, ensuring timely and efficient delivery of goods. As a leader in the industry, Linfox Asia continuously strives to enhance our services through sustainable practices, digital transformation, and a customer\\-centric approach. Our company culture emphasizes collaboration, integrity, and continuous learning, making us a trusted partner for businesses seeking reliable logistics solutions.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are seeking a motivated and enthusiastic Junior .NET Developer to join our expanding development team at Linfox Asia. This entry\\-level position is ideal for recent graduates or professionals with up to two years of experience who are eager to grow their skills in software development. The successful candidate will play a vital role in developing and maintaining web and mobile applications that support our logistics operations. You will work closely with senior developers and cross\\-functional teams to deliver high\\-quality solutions, gaining practical experience in C\\#, .NET technologies, and mobile app development using Flutter or Flutter Flow. This role offers a unique opportunity to contribute to impactful projects within a dynamic environment focused on innovation and continuous improvement.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
* Proficiency in C\\# and .NET Core frameworks.
* Experience with Entity Framework and LINQ for data access.
* Understanding of object\\-oriented programming principles, data structures, and algorithms.
* Exposure to Flutter or Flutter Flow for mobile application development (Android/iOS).
* Familiarity with SQL databases such as MS SQL Server, MySQL, or PostgreSQL.
* Basic knowledge of version control systems, particularly Git.
* Strong problem\\-solving skills and effective communication abilities.
* Experience or familiarity with SPA frameworks like React and .NET Blazor is a plus.
* Knowledge of front\\-end technologies including JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and Bootstrap.
* Understanding of Agile and Scrum methodologies.
* Experience with cloud platforms such as Azure or AWS.
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines to facilitate continuous integration and deployment.


**Responsibilities**
* Develop, maintain, and support applications utilizing .NET Core and ASP.NET frameworks.
* Assist in designing and implementing RESTful APIs and backend services to support various applications.
* Collaborate with senior developers to write clean, efficient, and maintainable code adhering to best practices.
* Contribute to front\\-end development efforts using Flutter for cross\\-platform mobile applications on Android and iOS.
* Work closely with QA, UI/UX designers, and product teams to ensure the delivery of high\\-quality, user\\-friendly solutions.
* Participate in code reviews, team meetings, and knowledge\\-sharing sessions to foster continuous learning and improvement.
* Assist in troubleshooting and resolving application issues to ensure seamless user experiences.
* Stay updated with emerging technologies and industry trends to incorporate innovative solutions into projects.


**Benefits**
 At Linfox Asia, we value our employees and are committed to providing a supportive and enriching work environment. Benefits include competitive salary packages, opportunities for professional development, and exposure to cutting\\-edge technologies. We offer flexible working arrangements, health and wellness programs, and a collaborative team culture that encourages innovation and growth. Additionally, employees gain valuable experience working on impactful projects within a global logistics leader, paving the way for career advancement and skill enhancement in the technology domain.
   

  

 Equal Opportunity
   

  

 Linfox Asia is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate based on race, gender, age, religion, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by law. Our hiring decisions are based solely on merit, skills, and qualifications, ensuring a fair and equitable process for all applicants.

description:
**Job Description**
 We have an exciting and rewarding opportunity for you to take your software engineering career to the next level.
   

  

 As a Software Engineer III at JPMorgan Chase within the Chief Technology Office team, you will be a seasoned member of an agile team, tasked with designing and delivering trusted, market\\-leading technology products in a secure, stable, and scalable manner. You will be responsible for implementing critical technology solutions across multiple technical areas, supporting various business functions to achieve the firm’s business objectives.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Executes software solutions, design, development, and technical troubleshooting with ability to think beyond routine or conventional approaches to build solutions or break down technical problems
* Creates secure and high\\-quality production code and maintains algorithms that run synchronously with appropriate systems
* Produces architecture and design artifacts for complex applications while being accountable for ensuring design constraints are met by software code development
* Gathers, analyzes, synthesizes, and develops visualizations and reporting from large, diverse data sets in service of continuous improvement of software applications and systems
* Proactively identifies hidden problems and patterns in data and uses these insights to drive improvements to coding hygiene and system architecture
* Contributes to software engineering communities of practice and events that explore new and emerging technologies
* Adds to team culture of diversity, opportunity, inclusion, and respect


**Required Qualifications, Capabilities, And Skills**
* Formal training or certification on UI concepts and 3\\+ years applied experience
* Proficient in ReactJs, Redux, React hooks. Proficiency using GIT for source control
* Hands\\-on practical experience in system design, application development, testing, and operational stability
* Proficient in coding in Javascript, TypeScript, HTML, CSS, Responsiveness and Accessibility.
* Strong understanding of front\\-end coding and development technologies
* Experience in developing, debugging, and maintaining code in a large corporate environment with one or more modern programming languages and database querying languages
* Practice of Clean code principles, TDD and React Testing Library, Playwright end\\-to\\-end testing.


**Preferred Qualifications, Capabilities, And Skills**
* Familiarity with modern front\\-end technologies
* Overall knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle coupled with solid understanding of agile methodologies such as CI/CD, Application Resiliency, and Security
* Demonstrated knowledge of software applications and technical processes within a technical discipline in cloud
* Exposure to cloud technologies

title: Junior Data Engineer
description:
IMEA (India, Middle East, Africa)
   

  

 India
   

  

 LIXIL INDIA PVT LTD
   

  

 Employee Assignment
   

  

 Fully remote possible
   

  

 Full Time
   

  

 1 November 2025
   

  

**Title:** 
**Data Engineer**
**Overview**
 A Data Engineer plays a crucial role in designing, building, and maintaining the infrastructure that powers our data\\-driven decisions. You’ll be at the heart of our data ecosystem, ensuring data is reliably collected, stored, and processed to provide clean, accessible data for our analytics and business intelligence teams.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Design \\& Develop Data Pipelines: Assist in building, maintaining, and optimizing scalable ETL/ELT data pipelines to ingest and transform large datasets from diverse sources, including APIs, databases, and third\\-party systems.
* Data Modeling \\& Warehousing: Support the development of robust data models and schemas in both relational and cloud\\-native data warehouses (e.g., Google BigQuery).
* Ensure Data Integrity: Monitor, troubleshoot, and improve the performance and reliability of data pipelines, ensuring data quality, consistency, and accuracy.
* Data Source Integration: Work with various data formats and sources, including structured, semi\\-structured, and streaming data.
* Data Governance \\& Security: Collaborate with senior engineers to enforce data governance, quality, and security standards across the organization.
* Code \\& Automation: Write clean, efficient, and well\\-documented code (SQL, Python) for data engineering tasks. Utilize Git and CI/CD principles for version control and automated deployments.
* Team Collaboration: Document data workflows and contribute to a shared knowledge base, providing ad\\-hoc support to data analysts and business users.


**Required Skills \\& Experience**
* Educational Background: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or a related field.
* Professional Experience: 1\\-3 years of hands\\-on experience in a data engineering or similar role.
* Technical Proficiency:
* Communication \\& Soft Skills:
* Availability: Able to join immediately.

title: Data Scientist - Generative AI
description:
**Primary Responsibilities**
* Built and implemented enterprise\\-level GenAI chatbots capable of natural\\-language search over extensive document repositories and databases.
* Research and develop multi\\-agentic systems for production\\-grade applications that handle large\\-scale documents and big data
* Optimize vector databases for enterprise\\-scale semantic search, context management, chat history, and source attribution
* Build document processing pipelines with intelligent chunking, metadata extraction, and multi\\-format handling
* Implement advanced retrieval strategies: hybrid search, re\\-ranking, and custom evaluation frameworks
* Work in AWS cloud platform for deployment \\- handle concurrent requests and scale
* Integrate and optimize LLMs via AWS Bedrock, or Azure with hallucination mitigation
* Debug and resolve retrieval quality issues, latency bottlenecks, and cost optimization challenges
* Opportunity to mentor and shape GenAI practices across the organization
* Individual Contributor reporting to Engineering Manager


**Skills Required**
* Experience building GenAI applications from scratch including custom chunking strategies, metadata extraction, multi\\-format document processing pipelines, indexing, context management, memory management, fine\\-tuning techniques, model compression techniques, etc. (Must be able to demonstrate through technical justification and code)
* Vector database production implementation: indexing, retrieval optimization, performance tuning
* Embeddings and semantic search: sentence\\-transformers, similarity search, distance metrics implementation
* Advanced retrieval techniques: hybrid search (semantic \\+ keyword), multi\\-stage retrieval
* Production LLM integration / hosting: context management, token optimization, streaming responses, citation systems
* Evaluation \\& metrics for RAG systems \\& chatbots
* Knowledge of deployment, monitoring, ethics, and governance principles; RESTful API development with FastAPI including error handling

title: AI/ML Engineering Interns
description:
**About Logikality** 




  





 Logikality is building
 **AI\\-powered mortgage decision intelligence,** 
*guideline\\-defensible decisions* 
 with full audit trails for regulators and investors.
 



  





 Lenders today lose money on every loan. Back\\-office costs have exploded from roughly $7,600 to over $11,000–$12,600 per loan, and 70–90% of the work is still manual despite decades of “automation.”
 



  





 We’ve built a platform that:
 


* Processes
 **180–250 pages/minute** 
 at \\~
 **98% accuracy**
* Automates underwriting decisions and conditions with
 **70–75% acceptance**
* Validates loans against
 **200\\+ Fannie/Freddie/investor rules** 
 with full explainability and auditability
* Delivers
 **$1,500–2,000 savings per loan** 
 ,
 **4–6\\.5 hours** 
 manual effort saved, and
 **payback in under 30 days** 
 (625–1000% ROI)



  





 Under the hood, we have a
 **15,000\\+ document golden test set** 
 and an
 **evidence\\-first architecture** 
 where every decision is backed by traceable data, rules, and timestamps that regulators can trust.
 



  





**What you’ll work on** 




  





 As an
 **AI/ML Intern** 
 , you’ll work directly with the founding team (IIT \\+ Fortune 500 AI \\+ mortgage veterans) on problems like:
 



  




* Turning a messy loan file into a
 **self\\-organizing workspace** 
 : documents auto\\-classified, data extracted, and linked back to evidence.
* Building and evaluating models that
 **compute borrower income** 
 across W\\-2s, paystubs, rental income, SSI, etc., then explain the math in auditor\\-ready language.
* Designing copilot\\-style workflows that
 **generate underwriting conditions** 
 , track resolution, and minimize rework.
* Working on
 **LLM \\+ retrieval \\+ rules** 
 pipelines that must be
 *explainable* 
 and
 *safe* 
 in a regulated environment.
* Using our
 **15k\\+ document golden dataset** 
 plus underwriter feedback to create lender\\-specific playbooks and continuous learning loops.



  





 You’ll see
 **real production data and constraints** 
 (under NDA), not toy Kaggle problems.
 



  





**What you’ll learn** 




  




* How to build
 **decision\\-ready AI** 
 , not just models that output numbers.
* How to design for
 **auditability and provenance** 
 as first\\-class citizens.
* How to ship ML in a
 **highly regulated, high\\-stakes** 
 domain.
* How to work with a small, senior team where your work is
 **immediately visible** 
 .



  





**Who we’re looking for** 




  





 We care more about
 **traits** 
 than buzzwords. Our ideal interns score high on:
 **coachability, curiosity, prior success, intelligence, and work ethic** 
 .
 



  





**Must\\-haves** 



* Strong programming skills in
 **Python** 
 (NumPy / Pandas / basic PyTorch or TensorFlow).
* Solid ML fundamentals: supervised learning, evaluation metrics, overfitting/regularization, basic NLP.
* Evidence of
 **prior success** 
 in something hard: projects, research, competitions, open\\-source, startups, Olympiads, etc.
* High
 **curiosity** 
 – you self\\-teach; you’ve gone down rabbit holes on your own.
* Ability to commit
 **20\\+ hours/week** 
 for
 **6 months** 
 .
* Comfortable with a
 **high\\-intensity, unpaid internship** 
 where the main “compensation” is learning, network, and a serious shot at a core role.



  





**Nice\\-to\\-haves** 



* Experience with
 **NLP / LLMs / RAG** 
 , or productionizing ML systems.
* Interest/experience in
 **fintech, lending, credit risk, or mortgages** 
 .
* Experience designing
 **data/label pipelines** 
 and evaluation harnesses.

title: Estuate - Software Engineer - Digital Asset Management
description:
**Job Description**
* We are seeking a Software Engineer to support and enhance Malibu's Tenovos Digital Asset Management (DAM) platform.
* This role blends L2 application support with development responsibilities for small enhancements, bug fixes, and integrations.
* With 3\\-4 years of experience, the engineer will focus on day\\-to\\-day incident management, automation, and assisting the Technical Lead in delivering long\\-term stability and improvements to the DAM platform.
* Provide day\\-to\\-day Level 2 support for Tenovos DAM, resolving incidents and service requests.
* Monitor ticketing systems and escalate complex issues to the Technical Lead.
* Perform daily system health checks and troubleshoot abnormalities.
* Troubleshoot user and workflow issues, including permissions, metadata, and asset workflows.
* Develop and test minor bug fixes, enhancements, and scripts for automation.
* Assist in debugging APIs and integrations with external systems.
* Document solutions, SOPs, and troubleshooting guides for internal knowledge base.
* Collaborate with the Technical Lead and cross\\-functional teams on system improvements.


**Required Qualifications**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field.
* 3\\-4 years of experience in application support and software development.
* Hands\\-on exposure to Digital Asset Management platforms (Tenovos preferred; AEM acceptable if willing to transition).
* Development experience with Java/.NET and scripting languages (Python, PowerShell, or Shell).
* Basic\\-to\\-intermediate SQL knowledge for troubleshooting.
* Familiarity with REST APIs and API testing tools (Postman, Swagger).
* Experience with ITSM tools (ServiceNow, Jira, Zendesk).
* Strong problem\\-solving skills and willingness to learn advanced troubleshooting.


**Preferred Qualifications**

* Experience with workflow automation (Workfront Fusion, similar tools).
* Familiarity with DevOps pipelines and version control (Git, Jenkins).
* Strong documentation skills and experience working in global support teams.
* Our commitment to Equal Opportunity Employment (EOE).

description:
Why Join Us?
   

  

 We're looking for a highly experienced and motivated Networking QA Engineer with excellent problem\\-solving and debugging skills. If you're passionate about quality in the world of SASE solutions, then join our team.
   

  

* You will be highly involved in SASE’s development process, starting from the requirement gathering, prioritization, and documentation.

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

* 
+ Manage, Prepare and execute feature test plan for cross team features

+ Execute the regression together with your QA teammates

*

+ 3 years’ experience with planning, configuring, building networks from scratch involving elements such as: Firewalls/Routers/VPN Concentrators of top\\-5 vendors such as: (Palo Alto/Check Point/Cisco/Juniper/Fortinet)
+ 3 years' experience with conducting different software QA testing types (functional and non\\-functional) and QA methodologies
+ Excellent problem\\-solving and communication skills
+ Consistently demonstrates a high level of integrity and professionalism
+ High attention to detail

+ Knowledge in Amazon AWS or Azure \\- Advantag
